DOC.brief_summary: Aims study : This randomized-controlled trial test effect robot-assisted gait training locomotor function motor unit fire rate multiple sclerosis subject severe gait impairment . The control group treat conventional physical therapy . Subjects method : 60 multiple sclerosis patient recruit two outpatient rehabilitation clinic . Informed consent obtain . Participants randomize Robot-assisted gait training ( experimental group ) conventional therapy ( control group ) randomization stratification approach , accord block randomization 4 . The experimental group receive 12 robot-assisted gait training session 6 week ( 2 sessions/week ) . The control group receive 12 conventional therapy session 6 week ( 2 sessions/week ) , focus gait training . Primary outcome measure neurophysiological measure ( motor unit fire rate characteristic ) clinical test gait speed ( 10m walk test ) . Secondary outcome measure include : clinical test walk endurance ( six minute walk test ) , balance ( Berg Balance Test ) mobility ( Up Go Test ) . Clinical assessment lower-extremities spasticity ( Modified Ashworth Scale ) , motor fatigue ( Fatigue Severity Scale ) , depression ( PHQ-9 ) quality life ( SF-36 ) monitor . Subject acceptance confidence treatment track Visual Analog Scale . Outcome measure assess week prior treatment initiation ( T0 ) , 6 session ( T1 ) , week end treatment ( T2 ) 3 month follow-up ( T3 ) evaluate treatment retention , clinician blind treatment .
